com.linecorp.armeria.server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linecorp.armeria.server.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public final class Server
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Listens to ServerPorts and delegates client requests to Services.
    See Also:
    ServerBuilder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Optional<ServerPort> activePort()
      Returns the primary ServerPort that this Server is listening to.
      Map<InetSocketAddress,ServerPort> activePorts()
      Returns all ServerPorts that this Server is listening to.
      void addListener(ServerListener listener)
      Adds the specified ServerListener to this Server, so that it is notified when the state of this Server changes.
      void close()
      A shortcut to stop().get().
      ServerConfig config()
      Returns the configuration of this Server.
      String defaultHostname()
      Returns the hostname of the default VirtualHost, which is the hostname of the machine unless configured explicitly via ServerBuilder.defaultVirtualHost(VirtualHost).
      EventLoop nextEventLoop()
      Returns a EventLoop from the worker group.
      int numConnections()
      Returns the number of open connections on this Server.
      boolean removeListener(ServerListener listener)
      Removes the specified ServerListener from this Server, so that it is not notified anymore when the state of this Server changes.
      CompletableFuture<Void> start()
      Starts this Server to listen to the ServerPorts specified in the ServerConfig.
      CompletableFuture<Void> stop()
      Stops this Server to close all active ServerPorts.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • config

        public ServerConfig config()
        Returns the configuration of this Server.

      • defaultHostname

        public String defaultHostname()
        Returns the hostname of the default VirtualHost, which is the hostname of the machine unless configured explicitly via ServerBuilder.defaultVirtualHost(VirtualHost).

      • activePorts

        public Map<InetSocketAddress,ServerPort> activePorts()
        Returns all ServerPorts that this Server is listening to.
        Returns:
        a Map whose key is the bind address and value is ServerPort. an empty Map if this Server did not start.
        See Also:
        activePort()

      • activePort

        public Optional<ServerPort> activePort()
        Returns the primary ServerPort that this Server is listening to. This method is useful when a Server listens to only one ServerPort.
        Returns:
        Optional.empty() if this Server did not start

      • addListener

        public void addListener(ServerListener listener)
        Adds the specified ServerListener to this Server, so that it is notified when the state of this Server changes. This method is useful when you want to initialize/destroy the resources associated with a Service: 
        
 > public class MyService extends SimpleService {
 >     @Override
 >     public void serviceAdded(Server server) {
 >         server.addListener(new ServerListenerAdapter() {
 >             @Override
 >             public void serverStarting() {
 >                 ... initialize ...
 >             }
 >
 >             @Override
 >             public void serverStopped() {
 >                 ... destroy ...
 >             }
 >         }
 >     }
 > }

      • removeListener

        public boolean removeListener(ServerListener listener)
        Removes the specified ServerListener from this Server, so that it is not notified anymore when the state of this Server changes.

      • start

        public CompletableFuture<Void> start()
        Starts this Server to listen to the ServerPorts specified in the ServerConfig. Note that the startup procedure is asynchronous and thus this method returns immediately. To wait until this Server is fully started up, wait for the returned CompletableFuture: 
        
 ServerBuilder builder = new ServerBuilder();
 ...
 Server server = builder.build();
 server.start().get();

      • stop

        public CompletableFuture<Void> stop()
        Stops this Server to close all active ServerPorts. Note that the shutdown procedure is asynchronous and thus this method returns immediately. To wait until this Server is fully shut down, wait for the returned CompletableFuture: 
        
 Server server = ...;
 server.stop().get();

      • nextEventLoop

        public EventLoop nextEventLoop()
        Returns a EventLoop from the worker group. This can be used for, e.g., scheduling background tasks for the lifetime of the Server using EventExecutorGroup.scheduleAtFixedRate(Runnable, long, long, TimeUnit). It is very important that these tasks do not block as this would block all requests in the server on that EventLoop.

      • close

        public void close()
        A shortcut to stop().get().
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • numConnections

        public int numConnections()
        Returns the number of open connections on this Server.
